fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Distress Relief Fund For The Differently Abled (Medical Treatment)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Distress Relief Fund for the Differently Abled (Medical Treatment)” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Top Class Education For Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) pursuing studies beyond class 12th admitted in a full-time course in one of the 'notified institutions'.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) studying in class 9th and class 10th in a government school or a school recognized by the government or CBSE or State Board. This includes persons with visual, hearing, speech, loco-motor, mental retardation & other disabilities.

fields.schemeName: State Programme For Rehabilitation Of Persons With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “State Programme for Rehabilitation of Persons with Disabilities” is a state sector ongoing scheme implemented for the welfare and providing rehabilitation services to disabled persons of the state under the Person with Disabilities Act 1995.

fields.schemeName: Pension to the Persons who lost 100% eye sight
fields.briefDescription: “Pension to the Persons Who Lost 100% Eye Sight" was launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide a monthly pension of ₹2,000/- to the differently-abled persons who are 10 years and above in age and have 100% blindness.

fields.schemeName: Homes For Intellectually Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The "Homes for Intellectually Impaired Persons" is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. In this scheme, Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection are admitted into shelter homes through the Child Welfare Committees.

fields.schemeName: Chief Ministergi Shotharabasingi Tengbang
fields.briefDescription: "Chief Ministergi Shotharabasingi Tengbang" is a Social Welfare Scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Manipur. The scheme provides Free Travel & Concession to the Persons with Disabilities. All the PwDs who are a domicile of the State of Manipur are eligible.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Visually Impaired Advocates
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance to visually impaired Advocates” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Action Plan for Skill Development of Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A dedicated skill development program aimed at providing high-quality vocational training with a focus on PwDs. The objective is to enhance the skills of PwDs by providing quality vocational skill training, enabling them to gain meaningful employment and become contributing members of society.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Persons With Disabilities Scheme In Colleges: Financial Assistance To Visually Challenged Teachers
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme has been formulated to help visually challenged permanent teachers to pursue teaching and research with the help of a Reader and by using teaching and learning aids by way of providing Reader’s Allowance and funds for the purchase of Braille books, recorded materials etc.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister's State Disability Pension Scheme - Sikkim
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Chief Minister's State Disability Pension Scheme (CMDPS)” was started by the Women & Child Welfare Department, Govt. of Sikkim to provide financial assistance to the differently abled person who has a disability of 40% and above.

fields.schemeName: State Award for the Welfare of the Handicapped
fields.briefDescription: “State Award for the Welfare of the Handicapped” was launched by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry. The individuals and institutions are conferred awards on 3rd December every year to encourage them to become economically productive to serve the cause of the Persons with Disability.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Sarees and Dhoties to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, free dhothies and sarees or equivalent Direct Benefit Transfer are provided to the differently abled persons who are benefited under the monthly financial assistance schemes in lieu of Diwali / Pongal / local regional festivals.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Prosthetic Appliances to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Supply of Prosthetic Appliances to Differently Abled Persons” was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. In this scheme, prosthetic appliances are supplied to differently-abled persons free of cost to minimize the mobility challenges experienced by them.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Reimbursement of Educational Expenses to Hearing Impaired Students Pursuing Special Higher Education Courses Inside or Outside the Union Territory of Puducherry
fields.briefDescription: This scheme was introduced by the  Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry to provide financial assistance to Hearing Impaired and Visually Impaired students for pursuing their special higher studies. Through this scheme, the reimbursement of the entire fee is granted from the first year onwards.

fields.schemeName: Cash Award to the Meritorious Visually Impaired Students Obtaining First Three Ranks at the State Level in the SSLC and HSC Examination
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to award cash prizes to meritorious differently-abled persons (visually challenged students) who are studying in government and private schools of Puducherry and secure first, second and third rank concerning total marks in the SSLC and HSC exams.

fields.schemeName: Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities”, who are facing the mainstream of society due to their disabilities are provided motorized tricycles free of cost to those unable to connect.

fields.schemeName: Petrol Subsidy To Persons With Disability
fields.briefDescription: Under the Petrol Subsidy To Persons With Disability scheme handicapped person using motorized vehicles are entitled to 50% subsidy on actual expenditure on the purchase of petrol/diesel subject to fulfillment of other conditions laid down under the scheme.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Vishesh Yogyajan Sammaan Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhyamantri Vishesh Yogyajan Samman Pension Yojana" (MVSYS) stands as a testament to the commitment of the Government of Rajasthan towards the welfare of its citizens, particularly those with disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Prosthetic Aid and Appliances for Person with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a Person with Disabilities with 40% or more disability is given relief in his/her disability as well as equipment for self-employment within the limit of ₹20,000/-. The scheme is fully funded by the state government.

fields.schemeName: Sant Surdas Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, monthly financial assistance is provided to Persons with Disabilities aged between 0 and 17 years, who have a disability of more than 80% and are registered in the Below Poverty Line (BPL) list.

fields.schemeName: Free Travel in S.T Bus to the Disabled Persons
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the benefit of free travel in all types of busses of the Gujarat State Road Transport Corporation is provided to Person with Disabilities in all state routes and also provides the benefit of travel to the last route out of state.

fields.schemeName: Unemployment Allowance to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Unemployment Allowance to Differently Abled Persons" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide unemployment allowance to differently-abled persons.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Speech and Hearing Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Speech and Hearing Impaired Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to differently-abled couple.

fields.schemeName: Establishing Aavin Parlour for Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Establishing Aavin Parlour for Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to create self-employment avenues for differently abled persons, the govt. has issued orders to establish Parlour.

fields.schemeName: Modified Special Wheel Chairs for Persons Affected with Cerebral Palsy
fields.briefDescription: The 'Modified Special Wheel Chairs for Persons Affected with Cerebral Palsy' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of differently abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide modified special wheel chairs to cerebral palsy affected differently abled persons.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Marriage
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance for Marriage" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, a sum of ₹2,000/- is given to meet the marriage expenses of the differently abled person or his son or daughter.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Differently Abled Persons Marrying Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Differently Abled Persons Marrying Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to differently-abled couple.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Accidental Disability
fields.briefDescription: "West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Accidental Disability" is a social welfare scheme by the West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Board, that provides one-time assistance to the registered Migrant Worker in case of disability arising out of accidents during work.

fields.schemeName: Smart Phone for Hearing and Visually Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Smart Phone for Hearing and Visually Impaired Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to distribute smart phone to needy visually impaired & hearing impaired students, unemployed youth, self-employed.

fields.schemeName: Goggles by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department
fields.briefDescription: The 'Goggles by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to distribute goggles to needy visually impaired persons to enable them to protect themselves from sunlight.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Non Governmental Organisations
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance to Non Governmental Organisations" scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the NGO run a school for children with intellectual disability.

fields.schemeName: Early Intervention Centre for Children with Cerebral Palsy in SRTC, Chennai and Tiruchirapalli Districts
fields.briefDescription: The "Early Intervention Centre for Children with Cerebral Palsy in SRTC, Chennai and Tiruchirapalli Districts" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, stimulation training is given to the children affected with cerebral palsy.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance of Hearing Machine/Hearing Aid to Workers and their Dependents- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,000/- or the actual cost of the hearing aid, whichever is less, is provided to workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in the state of Haryana and their dependents for the purchase of a hearing aid machine.

fields.schemeName: Destitute Differently Abled Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Destitute Differently Abled Pension Scheme" was launched by the Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to give a pension of ₹1,000/- to destitute differently-abled persons aged 45 years and above with disability level of 60% and above.

fields.schemeName: Sanction of Laptops - Andhra Pradesh
fields.briefDescription: The "Sanction of Laptops" scheme aims to distribute laptops to visually challenged, hearing impairments, speech impairments, and orthopedic challenges students pursuing professional courses. The A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation proposes to procure 200 laptops.

fields.schemeName: Sanctioning of Tricycles of Orthopedically Challenged
fields.briefDescription: The "Sanctioning of Tricycles of Orthopedically Challenged" scheme aims to provide tricycles to orthopedically challenged individuals to enhance their mobility and independence. This initiative ensures that eligible individuals receive the necessary support to lead active and self-reliant lives.

fields.schemeName: Sanctioning of Daisy Players to Visually Challenged
fields.briefDescription: The "Sanctioning of Daisy Players to Visually Challenged" scheme aims to distribute daisy players to visually challenged students pursuing 9th Class to Degree as per the Action Plan 2017-18.

fields.schemeName: Additional Pension to 100% Disabled Ex-Serviceman having No Child
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides an additional amount of ₹100/- p.m., in addition to pension amount, to 100% disabled ex-servicemen who were members of Armed Forces & have been released from service due to 100% disability/permanent incapacity to work, provided disability or incapacity is attributable to service.

fields.schemeName: Ex-Gratia Grant for Disability to CAPF Personnel
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, ex-gratia grant will be given to those personnel of the CAPF hailing from Haryana who get disabled for life and are boarded out of service due to disability declared as in war/operation, in operational area, terrorist activities and natural calamities etc.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Grant for the Marriage of the Daughter of War Disabled Ex-Servicemen above 50% Disability
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- is provided for the marriage of each dependent daughter of war-disabled ex-servicemen whose disability has been assessed above 50%, for up to two daughters who are at least 18 years old.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Para/Tetra/Hemi Plegic Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹3,000/- per month shall be granted to Paraplegic, Tetraplegic, and Hemiplegic Ex-Servicemen who are bonafide residents of Haryana State and are not in receipt of any kind of financial assistance from any department of the Haryana Government.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Social Security Scheme: Pension to Physically Challenged Persons
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹1,000/- is provided to poor physically handicapped persons (including those who are blind, deaf, or dumb) with a degree of disability 40% or above and having no source of income.

fields.schemeName: Supply Free Laptops to Visually Impaired Students Pursuing Higher Education
fields.briefDescription: The 'Supply Free Laptops to Visually Impaired Students Pursuing Higher Education' scheme is under the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government of Odisha. The scheme aims to provide free laptops to visually impaired students pursuing courses.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Campaign, Seminar and Sports under Disability Sector
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to extend financial support for National & International Events organized by reputed organizations or an individual person with disabilities working for welfare of Persons with Disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Government Institutions for Teaching and Training of Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to arrange for education and rehabilitation of children with disabilities by providing them free hostel, education-training, food, clothing and residential facilities.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme- Bihar
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹400/- is provided to persons with disabilities in the age group of 18 to 79 years who belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to support them financially. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

fields.schemeName: Workers In Case Of His Partial Permanent Disablement-JKBOCWWB
fields.briefDescription: The "Workers In Case of Partial Permanent Disablement" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, provides financial assistance to registered BOC workers in the event of their partial permanent disablement.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: A non-contributory pension scheme to provide social security to Divyangjans aged 18 and above who belong to a poor family (BPL) in society.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Scheme in Civil Service (Chhattisgarh)
fields.briefDescription: "Incentive Scheme in Civil Service"  aims to encourage bright and meritorious persons with disabilities to pass competitive exams in the field of civil services. Financial support is provided on passing the different stages of the Union/Chhattisgarh Public Service Commission Competitive Exams.

fields.schemeName: INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Urban)
fields.briefDescription: "INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Urban)" scheme aims to provide monthly pensions to persons with disabilities of 40% or above who are 18 years of age or above. To be eligible, they should be from a BPL family, be a resident of Andhra Pradesh, and not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.

fields.schemeName: Aastha Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide BPL-equivalent benefits to families with two or more specially-abled members. Under this scheme, eligible families receive free medical treatment, ration supplies, and other welfare benefits.

fields.schemeName: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Diploma)
fields.briefDescription: Saksham is a Scholarship Scheme by the Ministry of Education, implemented by AICTE, aimed at providing encouragement and support to specially-abled children to pursue technical education. This is an attempt to give every young specially-abled student the opportunity to study further.

fields.schemeName: Home for Mentally Challenged Children
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Home for Mentally Challenged Children" by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry, aims to provide care for children facing mental challenges, i.e. low Intelligence Quotient (IQ). The scheme offers free boarding and lodging, uniform sets, daily living needs, etc.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Samarth-Respite Care Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Samarth (Respite Care) scheme, launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, aims at setting up Samarth Centres for providing respite and residential care for the specified categories of Persons with Disability (PwD).

fields.schemeName: Shop Construction/Shop Operation Scheme For Rehabilitation Of PwDs
fields.briefDescription: The "Shop Construction/Shop Operation Scheme For Rehabilitation Of PwDs" Scheme has been started by the Government of Uttar Pradesh and operated by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Uttar Pradesh.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Disabled For Self Employment
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to facilitate the self-employment of unemployed disabled persons. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to persons with disabilities for self-employment, small-scale business, and agro-based project. This scheme is 100% funded by Govt. of Maharashtra.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Self-Employment For Trained Disabled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance to Self-Employment for Trained Disabled Persons" is a scheme by the Govt. of Maharashtra. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to facilitate the purchase of equipment for those disabled persons who are completing their vocational training.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Disha - Early Intervention and School Readiness Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims at setting up Disha Centres for early intervention for Person with Disability (PwD) in 0-10 years of age covered under the National Trust Act, through therapies, trainings and providing support to family members.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Vikaas-Day Care Scheme For Person with Disability Children
fields.briefDescription: Vikaas is a Day care scheme, primarily to expand the range of opportunities available to a person with disability attaining the age of 10 years for enhancing interpersonal and vocational skills as they are on a transition to higher age groups.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance For Aids And Appliances For Disabled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance for Aids and Appliances for Disabled Persons" is a scheme by the Govt. of Maharashtra. The objective of this scheme is to provide assistance to Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) for the purchase of aids and appliances as per their age group and the type of disability.

fields.schemeName: Residential School For Blinds
fields.briefDescription: The "Residential School for Blinds" have been established by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Jammu and Kashmir for the protection, welfare, and education of the Blind. The school is located at Roop Nagar, near Fire Brigade Office, Muthi, Jammu, 180013. The intake capacity is 50 inmates.

fields.schemeName: Divyang Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The State Government of Uttar Pradesh has launched Divyang Pension Yojana to improve and uplift the standard of living of disabled citizens.

fields.schemeName: Matru Jyothi - Financial Assistance For PwD Mothers
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Matru Jyothi - Financial Assistance for PwD Mothers” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Disabled Person Pension Scheme - Punjab
fields.briefDescription: Punjab State Government started a pension for disable person of the state.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Tri-Cycles (CBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, Tri-Cycles will be provided by the Board to the disabled registered construction workers and their dependents, once in life time.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Invalid Carriages (Motorized Tri-cycles) to the Persons With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: “Supply of Invalid Carriages (Motorized Tri-cycles) to the Persons With Disabilities” by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry is introduced to supply invalid carriages (motorised tricycles) free of cost to the differently abled persons engaged in gainful employment or pursuing education.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Stipend to Differently Abled Trainees
fields.briefDescription: "Grant of Stipend to Differently Abled Trainees" by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry was introduced to provide financial assistance to differently abled individuals undergoing technical or professional training. The objective is to enable them to successfully complete their training.

fields.schemeName: Divyang Shiksha Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the Madhya Pradesh government provides financial support to Disabled children of the state.

fields.schemeName: Allowance for 100% Blind
fields.briefDescription: The scheme  “Allowance for 100% Blind" aims to provide a monthly pension of ₹2,000/- to the blind persons of Tripura aged 10 years and above having 100% blindness. The application should be submitted to the nearest Child Development Project Officer (CDPO).

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme' is a state initiative by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Its goal is to offer a ₹1,000 pension to individuals aged 18 and above. Eligibility criteria include a disability percentage of 80% or above.

fields.schemeName: Assistance Scheme for Occupational Diseases (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The “Assistance Scheme for Occupational Diseases” has been implemented by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board (GBOCWWB) to provide financial assistance to registered construction workers for 15 types of occupational diseases and 23 types of serious injuries.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme ,launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, aims to provide affordable health insurance to the Persons with Disabilities (PwDs).

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Through the "Disability Pension" scheme, the worker who is permanently disabled due to Paralysis / Leprosy / Tuberculosis(TB) / Accident is provided with financial assistance of ₹300/- per month, and an ex-gratia payment of not more than ₹10,000/-, depending on the percentage of the disability.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Meet the Funeral Expenses of Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Meet the Funeral Expenses of Differently Abled Person' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons. In this scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,000/- is provided to meet the expenses in connection with funeral, in the event of the...

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance on the Natural Death of Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: "Financial Assistance on the Natural Death of Differently Abled Person" was launched by the Dept for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. A financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to the legal heir in the event of the natural death of the differently-abled person.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Allowance for Leprosy Affected Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Maintenance Allowance for Leprosy Affected Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance allowance to leprosy-affected persons.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Visually Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Visually Impaired Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide marriage assistance to a normal person marrying a visually Impaired Person.

fields.schemeName: Modular Reflective Folding Sticks (Smartcane)
fields.briefDescription: The 'Modular Reflective Folding Sticks (Smartcane)' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to distribute modular reflective folding sticks to needy visually impaired persons for self-orientation & independent mobility.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Personal Assistance Allowance to Differently Abled Persons with High Support Need
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme of Personal Assistance Allowance to Differently Abled Persons with High Support Need" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a personal assistance allowance of ₹1,000 to differently abled person.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Law Graduates
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance to Law Graduates" scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000 will be given to the differently abled Law graduates for enrolment in the Bar Council as lawyer.

fields.schemeName: Disability Assistance For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Disability Assistance for Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship (Above VIII Standard) - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Scholarship (Above VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide scholarships to differently-abled students studying in government school/colleges/training centre

fields.schemeName: Scholarship (I to VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Scholarship (I to VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide scholarships to purchase notebooks for differently-abled students studying in government school.

fields.schemeName: Special Education - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Special Education by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide free special education, & vocational training to the visually impaired, hearing-impaired person.

fields.schemeName: Retrofitted Petrol Scooters - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Retrofitted Petrol Scooters by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a retrofitted petrol scooter to orthopedically differently-abled persons.

fields.schemeName: Calipers and Crutches - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Calipers and Crutches by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. In this scheme, calipers & crutches are given to the needy & deserving orthopedically differently-abled persons for their easy mobility.

fields.schemeName: Tricycles - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The Department launched the 'Tricycles by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to distribute tricycles to deserving orthopedically differently abled persons affected by both lower limbs for their easy mobility

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Workers with a Visually, Physically or Mentally Disabled Child- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the disabled (blind, mentally retarded, mute and deaf) children of registered workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in the state of Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Artificial Limbs to Workers and their Dependents- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided for artificial limbs upto rates fixed by Saket Hospital, Chandimandir(Panchkula). This assistance is available to workers employed in industrial &commercial units in Haryana and their dependents, who become disabled due to the loss of vital organs.

fields.schemeName: Early Intervention Centres for Children with Autism
fields.briefDescription: The "Early Intervention Centres for Children with Autism" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, Early intervention programme emphasizes attending to social stimuli, imitation skills, language comprehension and usage.

fields.schemeName: Permanent Disability/ Death Benefit for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Permanent Disability/ Death Benefit for the Construction Workers" by the Sikkim BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, is a welfare scheme of the board that provides financial assistance is provided to the nominees/ dependents of a member, in case of his/her death or Permanent Disability.

fields.schemeName: Student Housing Scheme for Students with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, there is a provision to provide free housing facilities to a group of 5 disabled students, to motivate them for higher education, by providing accommodations to them. The accommodations are provided at a rental building.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹500/- is provided to severely disabled (with a disability of 80% and above) and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 to 79 years who are living below the poverty line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life.

fields.schemeName: Disabled State Level Award Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to encourage persons with disabilities and organizations working for the interests of persons with disabilities and to motivate the community for overall rehabilitation of persons with disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, eligible workers receive ₹1,000/- per month for permanent disabilities caused by conditions such as paralysis, leprosy, tuberculosis, or accidents. Additionally, a one-time assistance of ₹75,000/- is granted for total permanent disability, and ₹50,000/- for partial disability.

fields.schemeName: Training Centre for Specially-Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The Training Centre for Specially-Abled Persons scheme offers vocational courses for specially-abled individuals, funded by the Government of Mizoram. The centers provide courses in tailoring for females and tailoring/shoemaking for males, with a monthly stipend of ₹250 for the training period.

fields.schemeName: Stipend to Educated Unemployed
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, provides a stipend of ₹650 per month to assist 25 educated persons with disabilities who have registered in an Employment Exchange for over three years and have not been placed in gainful employment.

fields.schemeName: Vishesh Yogyajan Sukhad Dampatya Jeevan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to specially-abled individuals to support a happy married life after marriage. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000/- per couple is provided.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Persons with Disabilities for Purchase/Fitting of Artificial Limbs/Appliances
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹10,000/- to specially-abled individuals for self-employment and the purchase of artificial limbs/equipment to overcome physical disabilities.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme to Disabled Persons (Divyangjan)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Social Welfare Department to provide financial assistance to individuals with disabilities. The primary objective is to provide financial benefits to eligible Divyangjan to cater to their basic needs. The scheme is targeted at Divyangjan aged between 18 to 59 years.

fields.schemeName: Chief Ministergi Shotharabasingi Tengbang (CMST): Scholarship Of Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: "CMST: Scholarship of Students with Disabilities" is a Scholarship Scheme by the Govt. of Manipur. In this scheme, the Students with Disability who are a domicile of the State of Manipur, and are studying in Class 1st and and above are awarded with scholarship of upto ₹ 8,000/-.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Specially Abled Samman Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Rajasthan Government started a scholarship for Specially Abled persons.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension - West Bengal
fields.briefDescription: In 2010, the Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department of the West Bengal State Government introduced the "Disability Pension" scheme.

fields.schemeName: State Pre-metric Scholarship For Disabled
fields.briefDescription: The "State Pre-metric Scholarship for Disabled" is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. The objective of this scheme is to encourage students with disability (SwDs) to pursue education. This scheme is 100% funded by the Govt. of Maharashtra.

fields.schemeName: Home for Visually Challenged Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Home for Visually challenged Person" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to take care of the male persons who are visually impaired and who lack care and protection in society and are deprived of basic needs.

fields.schemeName: Issue of Free Bus Pass to Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Issue of Free Bus Pass to Differently Abled Person” was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The scheme provides free bus passes to all the differently abled persons to facilitate their mobility/transport in buses run by the Government and NGOs.

fields.schemeName: Assistance For Purchase of Aids/Appliances
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance for Purchase of Aids/Appliances" scheme is to provide support to individuals with disabilities by facilitating access to assistive devices and appliances.

fields.schemeName: Disable Marriage Scheme (Divyang Lagna Sahay)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to persons with disabilities when a person with a disability marries another person with a disability, as well as when a non-disabled person marries someone with a disability.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Orthopedically Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Orthopedically Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide marriage assistance to a normal person.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Allowance to Severely Affected Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Maintenance Allowance to Severely Affected Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance allowance to the severely affected persons who cannot be rehabilitated by any other assistance.

fields.schemeName: Matrimonial Incentives
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, if a Person with Disability (PwD) gets married to a non-disabled person, then the couple is provided a marriage incentive of up to ₹ 50,000. Only citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply for this scheme.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Disability Pension for Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Disability (Due to Accident or Other Reason) Scheme- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in Haryana based on their percentage of disability, whether the disability occurs due to an accident or other reasons inside or outside the workplace.

fields.schemeName: Deen Dayal Divyangjan Pension Scheme - Assam
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Deen Dayal Divyangjan Pension Scheme" was launched during 2018-19 by Social Welfare Department, Assam. The objective of the scheme is to provide a monthly pension of ₹1,000/- to each differently-abled person for taking care of their health.

fields.schemeName: Sanction of Motorized Three Wheeler to Orthopedically Challenged
fields.briefDescription: The "Sanction of Motorized Three Wheeler to Orthopedically Challenged" scheme aims to provide motorized three wheelers to orthopedically challenged persons. This initiative ensures that eligible individuals receive support to enhance their mobility and independence.

fields.schemeName: Additional Pension to 100% Disabled Ex-Serviceman having Children
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides an additional pension to 100% disabled ex-servicemen who were members of the Armed Forces & have been released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work, provided the disability or incapacity is attributable to service.

fields.schemeName: Partial Disability Benefit for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Partial Disability Benefit for the Construction Workers" by the Sikkim BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, is a welfare scheme of the board that provides financial assistance is provided to the nominees/ dependents of a member, in case of his/her partial disability.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Blind Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹3,000/‐ per month shall be granted to those Permanent Blind Ex-servicemen who are bonafide resident of Haryana & are not in receipt of any kind of pension/financial assistance either from Haryana Govt. or any other Department of Govt. of India.

fields.schemeName: Disability Benefit Who Met With an Accident at Worksite
fields.briefDescription: The "Disability Benefit Who Met With an Accident at Worksite" was launched by the Tripura Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Dept. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered construction worker who suffer from disabilities due to accident at their worksite

fields.schemeName: Rehabilitation of Cured Leprosy Persons: Assistance to Parents
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the parents of Cured Leprosy Persons in order to support such parents in successfully bringing up their children against societal intolerance, stigma, discrimination and violence.

fields.schemeName: Rehabilitation of Cured Leprosy Persons: Marriage Incentives & Support
fields.briefDescription: The “Marriage Incentives & Support” scheme is designed to assist Cured Leprosy Persons who face social and economic challenges in arranging marriages for their daughters.

fields.schemeName: Disability Relief - Telangana
fields.briefDescription: The "Disability Relief" scheme was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Dept. Telangana aimed at providing financial support to registered building & other construction workers who suffer from total or partial permanent disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Workers In Case Of Permanent Disablement-JKBOCWWB
fields.briefDescription: The "Workers In Case of Partial Permanent Disablement" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, provides financial assistance to registered Building and Other Construction (BOC) workers in the case of permanent disablement.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)
fields.briefDescription: The "Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)" is implemented by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept., Govt. of Maharashtra. The differently-abled individuals aged 18 to 65 years with a disability of 80% and above are eligible to receive a pension of ₹600/- per month.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Stipends to the Physically Handicapped Students
fields.briefDescription: "Grant of Stipends to the Physically Handicapped Students" scheme aims to improve the educational status of handicapped children studying in standards 1st to 10th. Monthly stipends (₹200 to ₹300) are provided to parents who are unable to send their children to school due to economic reasons.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister’s Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: Chief Minister Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme launched on 23.07.2009 as kalaingar Kaappittu Thittam. Now the scheme from January 2022 to 2027 is implemented through United India Insurance Company.

fields.schemeName: Union Territory of Lakshadweep Pension Scheme for Specially Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: ​The scheme aims to provide a monthly financial assistance of ₹1,500 to persons with disabilities, including those who are deaf, mute, blind, intellectually disabled, or orthopedically impaired, with a disability level of 40% or more and without any source of income.

fields.schemeName: RMEWF-Financial Assistance To 100% Disabled Child Of Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: A scheme to provide financial assistance to Ex-Servicemen or their widows for their 100% disabled child.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Incentive Reward Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Marriage Incentive Reward scheme for the marriage of disabled persons by the Government of Uttar Pradesh is being operated by the department since the year 1997.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance To Daughters Of Differently Abled Parents (Parinayam-I)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Marriage Assistance to Daughters of Differently Abled Parents (Parinayam-I)” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Artificial Limbs/Assistive Equipments Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Artificial Limbs/Assistive Equipments Scheme" was started by the Uttar Pradesh State government for persons with disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Direct Lending Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Through the "Direct Lending Scheme", the Punjab Scheduled Castes Land Development & Finance Corporation (PSCLDFC) provides direct loans for the economic upliftment of the members of the Scheduled Castes and Handicapped People in the state of Punjab.

fields.schemeName: State Post-metric Scholarship For Disabled
fields.briefDescription: The "State Post-metric Scholarship for Disabled" is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. The objective of this scheme is to encourage students with disability (SwDs) to pursue higher education.

fields.schemeName: Bus Traveling Facility For Visually Impaired/Bus Concession
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Bus Traveling Facility for Visually Impaired/Bus Concession” was started by Delhi Social Welfare Department for persons with disabilities. Under the scheme, Delhi Transport Corporation provides facility of free traveling in DTC Buses to the persons with vision impairment.

fields.schemeName: Manabik Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Manabik Pension Scheme is a financial assistance program launched in 2018 to provide monthly pensions to individuals with disabilities in West Bengal.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Social Security Scheme - Pension For Physically Challenged Persons
fields.briefDescription: ISSS-PPCP is a State Sponsored Scheme by the Social Welfare Dept. of the Govt. of J&K wherein financial assistance is provided to Physically Challenged Person who have meager support or no source of livelihood. A pension of ₹1000 per pensioner per month is deposited into their bank account.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme - Sikkim
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS)” was started by the Department of Women & Child Welfare, Govt. of Sikkim in 2014. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to differently-abled persons with severe or multiple disabilities of more than 80%.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Non-School Going Disabled Children Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance To Non-School Going Disabled Children Scheme” was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Haryana during the years 2008-09.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Physically/Mentally Disabled Children of Beneficiary (CBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, registered construction workers whose child has a disability of 40% or more will receive financial assistance.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Gharaunda-Group Home for Adults Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Gharaunda (Group Home for Adults) scheme aims at setting up Gharaunda Centres or Registered Organisations (RO) for for all Adult PwDs covered under the National Trust Act with adequate and quality care service with acceptable living standards including provision of basic medical care from profession

fields.schemeName: Non-Governmental Aided Organization (Special Schools And Vocational Training Centre) For Disabled
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, Special Education is provided to children with disability who are below the age of 18 years. The child should be enrolled in a special school run by a Non-Governmental Aided Organization. Vocational Training is given to special children above the age of 18 years.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance To Differently Abled Women (Parinayam-II)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Marriage Assistance to Differently Abled Women (Parinayam-II)” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Grant Of Incentive For Marriage Between Differently Abled Person And Normal Persons
fields.briefDescription: “Grant Of Incentive For Marriage Between Differently Abled Person And Normal Persons” by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry supports marriages between differently-abled individuals and those without disabilities. An incentive of ₹1,00,000/- is provided (₹20,000 as cash, and ₹80 as NSC).

fields.schemeName: Perunthalaivar Karma Veerar Kamarajar Scheme of Financial Assistance Towards Funeral Expenses of the Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Perunthalaivar Karma Veerar Kamarajar Scheme of Financial Assistance Towards Funeral Expenses of the Differently Abled Persons" was launched by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry. In this scheme, financial assistance of ₹ 15,000/- is provided to meet the funeral expenses.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Radio to the Blind Persons
fields.briefDescription: “Supply of Radio to the Blind Persons" was launched by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry. In this scheme, a radio is provided to the blind person for recreation. The applicant should have disability of 40% or above, and should be a Native/Resident of Puducherry.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Stipend to the Differently Abled Trainees of the Vocational Training Institutes
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, the differently abled persons undergoing any technical or professional training through Institutes are paid a fixed monthly stipend which will enable them to secure the training successfully in order to make their own earnings and become useful members of the society.

fields.schemeName: Award of Scholarship to Differently Abled Person Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Award of Scholarship to Differently Abled Person Students” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry is introduced to provide scholarship to the differently abled students, studying from Class 1st upto Postgraduate/ Professional courses.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa - Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa - Persons with Disabilities" was launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura to provide financial assistance to Persons with Disabilities in the form of a monthly pension of ₹2,000/-.

fields.schemeName: 60% and above Disability Allowances
fields.briefDescription: "60% and Disability Allowance" is a pension scheme by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Govt of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in the form of a monthly pension of ₹2,000/- to differently-abled persons with a disability of 60% and above.

fields.schemeName: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Disability Allowance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the differently able unemployed persons with 40% disability or more in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

fields.schemeName: Disability Assistance (ANBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered construction workers who become disabled due to an accident during the course of their employment on the production of a certificate from competent medical authorities in respect of the percentage of disability.

fields.schemeName: Differently Abled Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The 'Differently Abled Pension Scheme' aims to provide a pension of ₹1,000/- to differently-abled persons with disability level 40% and above. The scheme provides other benefits every year during the Pongal and Deepavali festival saree, dhoti and a nutritious meal is supplied through Anganwadi.

fields.schemeName: Disablement Benefit Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, financial assistance of ₹75,000/- is extended based on the Disablement Certificate issued by the Competent Authority to the Registered Construction Worker of the Board. The amount is credited through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the bank account of the worker.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Allowance for Persons Affected with Muscular Dystrophy
fields.briefDescription: The 'Maintenance Allowance for Persons Affected with Muscular Dystrophy' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance allowance to the person affected with muscular dystrophy.

fields.schemeName: Readers Allowance to Visually Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: 'Readers Allowance to Visually Impaired Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide readers allowance to visually impaired students, specific allowance rates based on the education level.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Disability Pension for the Construction Workers" by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Delhi, is a welfare scheme that provides monthly disability pension of ₹3000/- to the permanently disabled member due to paralysis, leprosy, T.B and accidents.

fields.schemeName: Braille Watches by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department
fields.briefDescription: The 'Braille Watches by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, braille watches are distributed to working visually impaired persons.

fields.schemeName: Walking Device - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Walking Device by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a rollator/walker to orthopedically differently abled children having difficulties in walking.

fields.schemeName: Early Intervention Centre for the Visually Impaired
fields.briefDescription: The "Early Intervention Centre for the Visually Impaired" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, visually impaired children are identified, assessed and prepared to join main stream education in 6 districts.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Divyangjan Sashaktikaran Chhatra Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Mukhyamantri Divyangjan Sashaktikaran Chhatra Yojana" aims to provide comprehensive support to the disabled community in Bihar. A significant component of this scheme involves the distribution of battery-operated tricycles to beneficiaries to enhance their mobility and independence.

fields.schemeName: Divyang Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: “Divyang Pension” scheme is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance to the specially abled people of the state.

fields.schemeName: Sikkim Grant of Scholarship to Students with Disabilities Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Sikkim has introduced the Sikkim Grant of Scholarship to Students with Disabilities Scheme, 2014. This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to differently-abled students to help them secure academic education and technical or professional training.

fields.schemeName: Sanctioning of Touch Phone to Hearing Challenged – Speech Impaired
fields.briefDescription: The "Sanctioning of Touch Phone to Hearing Challenged – Speech Impaired" aims to provide touch phones to hearing and speech-impaired individuals who know sign language as per the Action Plan 2017-18. The Assistant Directors, Department for the Welfare of Different, distribute the touch phones.

fields.schemeName: Ex-Gratia Grant for Disability to Defence Forces Personnel
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, the ex-gratia grant will be given to those personnel of the Defence Forces hailing from Haryana who get disabled for life and are boarded out of service due to disability declared as in war/operation, in operational area, terrorist activities & natural calamities, etc.

fields.schemeName: Disability Aids and Appliances - Telangana
fields.briefDescription: The "Disability Aids and Appliances" scheme was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Dept. Telangana to provide artificial limbs, wheelchairs, tricycles, & other fabricated appliances to registered construction workers who have lost their limb

fields.schemeName: Relief to the Unregistered Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Relief to the Unregistered Workers" scheme was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F Dept. Telangana aimed to provide financial assistance to the dependents of unregistered building & construction workers who die in accidents at construction sites.

fields.schemeName: Disability Relief Allowance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Disability Relief Allowance Scheme under the Department of Social Justice, Government of Himachal Pradesh provides financial assistance to individuals with disabilities to help them manage their living costs and improve their quality of life.

fields.schemeName: Ex-gratia Scheme: Disability Compensation (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Ex-gratia Scheme: Disability Compensation'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to the registered worker in the event of complete or partial disability.

fields.schemeName: Potency Development Plan
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to increase the mobility of all eligible PwDs of the state by providing them artificial limbs/assistive devices. The scheme provides artificial limbs/assistive devices worth up to ₹6,900/- to PwDs of 40% or more, provided they meet the other eligibility criteria.

fields.schemeName: Bihar Shatabdi Leper Welfare Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹1,500/- per month is given to leprosy patients with Visible Deformities Grade-II in the state. This scheme is fully funded by the State Government.

fields.schemeName: Permanent Disability Pension Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Permanent Disability Pension Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides pension to the registered beneficiary with at least 1 year of membership with the Board who becomes fully disabled.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Divyangjan Vivah Protsahan Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide social security to the disabled women/men of the state by encouraging their marriage and providing them financial assistance. This scheme is fully funded by the Government of Bihar.

fields.schemeName: Haryana Divyang Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This is a State scheme under which disabled persons of Haryana domicile with a minimum 60% disability and are 18 years of age and above, are given pension as per eligibility criteria laid down in the rules of the scheme.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Jammu and Kashmir)
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 15th August 1995, the "Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme"is a pension scheme by the Department Of Social Welfare  Jammu and Kashmir. In this scheme, a pension of ₹1000/- is provided to differently-abled individuals from 'Below Poverty Line'.

fields.schemeName: State Disability Pension
fields.briefDescription: The Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Mizoram launched the State Disability Pension scheme. It provides a monthly pension of ₹350 to 200 eligible individuals who are completely blind or bedridden.

fields.schemeName: INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Rural)
fields.briefDescription: "INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Rural)" scheme aims to disburse monthly pensions to the individuals 18 years or above in age and having a disability of 40% or above. To be eligible, they should be from a BPL family, be a resident of the district, and not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.

fields.schemeName: Disabled Marriage Incentive Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance for marriage with a view to social rehabilitation of persons with disabilities who do not fall under the category of income tax payers.

fields.schemeName: Divyangjan Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Divyangjan Scholarship Scheme" provides financial assistance for the education and training of differently-abled children, who are regular students in a school or college. The application needs to be submitted to the District Office, Panchayat and Social Welfare / Janpad Panchayat Office.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Post Matric Scholarship Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwD for students with disabilities pursuing a post-matric qualification from UGC/AICTE recognized universities, i.e. students of Class 11th, Class 12th, including Polytechnics, Post-Matriculation Diploma/Certificates and Bachelor’s/Master’s Degree/Diploma in India.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance Under The National Fund For Persons With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scheme by DoEPwDs for providing financial assistance to the Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) in support of various livelihood activities. The objective of these guidelines is to provide a framework to support financial assistance under the Fund for relevant core areas  for empowerment of PwDs.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Person with Disability / BPL
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support differently-abled brides/bridegrooms from BPL families by providing financial assistance to meet marriage-related expenses. Under this scheme, an amount of ₹30,000/- is provided to Scheduled Tribe, differently-abled brides/bridegrooms for their first marriage.

fields.schemeName: Scheme Of Assistance To Persons With Disabilities For Purchase/Fitting Of Aids And Appliances
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Assistance to Persons with Disabilities for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances" is a scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Manipur. In this scheme, the PwD is provided with Financial Assistance for the Purchase/Fitting of Hearing Aids, Artificial Limbs, etc.

fields.schemeName: Rehabilitation Treatment For The Disabled
fields.briefDescription: The government of Meghalaya provides rehabilitation treatment for persons with disabilities under the "Disability Rehabilitation Scheme".

fields.schemeName: Scheme For Providing Assistive Devices To Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Providing Assistive Devices to Differently Abled Persons” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Assistance For Purchase Of Spectacles By A Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles by A Differently Abled Persons" scheme in Tamil Nadu is a government initiative that aims to provide financial assistance to differently-abled individuals.

fields.schemeName: Nihshaktajan Vivaah Protsaahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: In 2008, Madhya Pradesh State Government started the "Nihshaktajan Vivaah Protsaahan Yojana" for differently ables persons

fields.schemeName: The Scheme Of State Award For Disabled
fields.briefDescription: The "The Scheme of State Award for Disabled" is a scheme by the Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. In this scheme, every year, the State Government felicitates awards to the Best Disabled Employees/Employers/Placement Agencies who have done outstanding work.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Special Ability Pension
fields.briefDescription: National Disability Pension Scheme is a government scheme aimed at providing financial assistance to specially-abled individuals residing in India.

fields.schemeName: GST Exemption Certificate Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "GST Exemption Certificate Scheme" has been introduced by the Dept. of Heavy Industries, for issuing certificates to Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) having a disability percentage equal to or greater than 40%. The scheme provides GSC Concession to orthopedically disabled persons on purchase of car.

fields.schemeName: Prosthetic Aid Scheme
fields.briefDescription: In the "Prosthetic Aid Scheme", Prosthetic Aids and Artificial Appliances (Tricycles, Wheel Chairs, Crutches, Hearing Aids, and Artificial Limbs, etc) are provided to Persons with Disability (e.g. blind, deaf, orthopedically or physically handicapped) by the Social Welfare Department.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Scheme Of Assistance To Disabled Persons For Purchase/Fitting Of Aids/Appliances
fields.briefDescription: The main objective of the Scheme is to assist needy disabled persons in procuring durable, sophisticated, scientifically manufactured, modern, standard aids and appliances that can promote their physical, social and psychological rehabilitation by reducing the effect of disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Special Education And Vocational Training Through Government Institutions
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, Special Education is provided to children with disability between the age group of 6 to 18 years in the Government Special Schools and Vocational Training is provided to special children above the age of 18 years. Only citizens who are permanent residents of Maharashtra are eligible.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Award For Marriage With Disabled Person
fields.briefDescription: "Incentive Award for Marriage with Disabled Person" is a Grant by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Manipur. In this scheme, incentive is granted to a person who marries a Person with Disability. This is a State Sponsored Scheme. Only the citizens who are domicile of Manipur can apply.

fields.schemeName: Unemployment Allowance To The Educated Unemployed Persons With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: "Unemployment Allowance to the Educated Unemployed Persons With Disabilities" is a Financial Assistance Scheme by the Govt. of Manipur. The payment of unemployment allowance will be applicable to all categories of disabilities except Intellectual Disabilities as specified in RoPwD Act 2016.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Financial Assistance to Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Financial Assistance to Differently Abled Person” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry was introduced to provide monthly financial assistance to Persons with Disability to maintain their minimum standard of living.

fields.schemeName: Government Special School for the Visually Handicapped and the Hearing Impaired
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Government Special School for the Visually Handicapped and the Hearing Impaired” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry, was introduced to facilitate the education and self-confidence development of visually impaired and hearing-impaired children.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Fuel Subsidy to Differently Abled Persons Who Are Owning Motorised Vehicles
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Fuel Subsidy to Differently Abled Persons Who Are Owning Motorised Vehicles” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry was introduced to provide a subsidy of upto 50 % of the cost of fuel to persons with disability who own motorised vehicles.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Transport Allowance to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Transport Allowance to Differently Abled Persons" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. In this scheme, a fixed sum ₹ 300/- per month shall be paid as Transport Allowance to the differently abled individuals.

fields.schemeName: Free Distribution of Rice to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Free Distribution of Rice to Differently Abled Persons” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry was introduced to distribute 15 Kg of rice per month or equivalent Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the differently abled persons.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Incentive for Marriage Between Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, an incentive of ₹2,00,000/- is provided, comprising ₹40,000 in cash and ₹1,60,000/- in the form of a National Savings Certificate (NSC), for the marriage between differently-abled individuals. The selection is periodical and depends on the availability of funds.

fields.schemeName: 6 Varsh Se Adhik Aayu Ke Bahuviklang Aur Mansik Roop Se Aviksit Nisaktjan Ke Liye Sahayata Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is M.P. To assist multiple handicapped and mentally underdeveloped persons above the age of six years who are unable to earn a living.

fields.schemeName: Pension To The Disabled Person
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the pension to the disabled person scheme is providing a pension to disabled persons is multifaceted, but generally centers around promoting social welfare, equity, and inclusivity.

fields.schemeName: Personal Accident Relief for Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Personal Accident Relief for Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Dept. for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons. In this scheme, accident relief is provided to differently abled persons up to a sum of ₹1,00,000/-(Death), & relief is given for loss of both legs/both hand...

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Allowance to Intellectually Disabled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Maintenance Allowance to Intellectually Disabled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance allowance to intellectually disabled persons.

fields.schemeName: Fitter Training to Hearing Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Fitter Training to Hearing Impaired Persons" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to give fitter training to the hearing-impaired candidates at the ITI, Guindy for two years and a stipend of ₹300 per month.

fields.schemeName: Modular Functional Artificial Limbs
fields.briefDescription: The 'Modular Functional Artificial Limbs' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, modular functional artificial limbs are provided for orthopedically differently-abled students, employed or self-employed.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance To Disabled Children (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Disabled Children (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Early Intervention Centre for Infants and Young Children with Hearing Impairment
fields.briefDescription: The "Early Intervention Centre for Infants and Young Children with Hearing Impairment" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, Infants and young children with hearing impairment are given training to develop speech.

fields.schemeName: Behind the Ear Hearing Aids by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: 'Behind the Ear Hearing Aids by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage hearing-impaired students to wear hearing aids to increase their speech capacity.

fields.schemeName: Magnifiers - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The Department launched the "Magnifiers by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department" scheme for differently-abled persons. Under this scheme, magnifiers are distributed to needy students with low vision to enable them to read books.

fields.schemeName: Government Institute for the Mentally Retarded - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Government Institute for the Mentally Retarded,Chennai' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, children with intellectual disability are given special education, vocational training, food, uniforms etc.

fields.schemeName: Early Intervention Center for the Children with Intellectually Disabled
fields.briefDescription: The "Early Intervention Center for the Children with Intellectually Disabled" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Try Cycle to Workers and their Dependents - Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹7,000/- or the actual price, whichever is less, will be provided to workers and their dependents employed in industrial and commercial units of Haryana for purchasing a tricycle if they lose their legs in an accident or due to any other reason.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Disabled Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹3,000/- per month shall be granted only to those Disabled Ex-Servicemen who are bonafide residents of Haryana State, who were discharged from the Armed Forces on medical grounds, and whose disability is not attributable to service.

fields.schemeName: Award Of Incentive For Marriage Between Persons With Benchmark Disabilities & Other Person
fields.briefDescription: This scheme was introduced in 2018 by the Department of Social Security & Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Government of Odisha. The scheme's goal is to help people with disabilities live normal and dignified lives and to encourage others to marry people with disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Artificial Limbs and Assistive Devices Supply Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to increase the mobility of persons with disabilities by reducing impact of their disabilities. The scheme provides artificial limbs/assistive devices worth up to ₹6,900/- to persons with disabilities of 40% or more, provided they meet the other eligibility criteria.

fields.schemeName: Battery Operated Wheelchair by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department
fields.briefDescription: The 'Battery Operated Wheelchair by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, battery-operated wheel chairs are given to muscular dystrophy & tetraplegia persons.

fields.schemeName: Bihar Disability Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide social security to the persons with disabilities (PwDs) of the poor family of the society by providing them financial assistance. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹400/- is given to PwDs of 40% or more, regardless of their income or age group.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to 75% or Permanent Disability
fields.briefDescription: The Financial Assistance to 75% or Permanent Disability was launched by the Maharashtra Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labor Department Maharashtra. In scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- to the registered worker in case of 75 % or more permanent disability.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disabled Pension Scheme (Madhya Pradesh)
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 1st April 2009, the scheme "Indira Gandhi National Disabled Pension Scheme" is a pension scheme by the Department of Social Welfare, Govt of Madhya Pradesh. In this scheme, a pension of ₹600/- is provided to differently-abled individuals from 'Below Poverty Line'.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme - Jharkhand
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension is provided to severely disabled and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 and above who are living below the poverty line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
fields.schemeName: Group Personal Accident Insurance Scheme For Coir Workers
fields.briefDescription: A group insurance scheme by MoMSME for coir workers. The scheme provides insurance cover against accidental death and permanent disability of the insured member.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Overseas Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment for regular, full-time students with disabilities to obtain higher education viz., Master's degree, or Ph.D. courses from foreign universities, in one of the specified fields of study.
